oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The history of Country Music - Volume 2 - Recording 2 - Side 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Country music history program with voice overs and commercial recordings likely for radio broadcast. Internet sources say the producer and narrator is Lee Cash. Subject matter pertains to the history of country music and recording is likely a syndicated radio show. Tape is labeled as: volume two, recording two, side one.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) The History of Country Music (Unconfirmed) ([Unidentified]) -- (00:03) An unidentified speaker discusses the growing success of Faron Young -- (00:18) Faron Young reflects on Hank Williams' influence on Young's decision to perform country music -- (00:33) If You Ain't Lovin' (You Ain't Livin') (Faron Young) -- (02:43) An unidentified speaker and Leroy Van Dyke both explain how Van Dyke created "The Auctioneer" -- (04:23) The Auctioneer (Leroy Van Dyke) -- (07:15) An unidentified speaker reflects on Young's various recording names he chose -- (07:40) Young reflects on recording "Gone" -- (08:15) Gone (Faron Young) -- (10:28) An unidentified speaker introduces "Young Love" -- (10:43) James reflects on how "Young Love" defined his guitar style -- (11:31) Young Love (Sonny James) -- (13:39) An unidentified speaker introduces the Everly Brothers -- (13:52) All I Have to Do is Dream (Everly Brothers) -- (16:05) An unidentified speaker introduces George Jones -- (16:10) Jones reflects on people's reason to choose country music -- (16:27) An unidentified speaker introduces "The Window Up Above" -- (16:30) The Window Up Above (George Jones) -- (18:54) An unidentified speaker and Van Dyke reflect on "Walk on By" -- (19:10) Walk on By (Leroy Van Dyke) -- (21:22) The History of Country Music (Unconfirmed) ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Cash, Lee; Radio programs; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
